intro: Hibbertia commutata, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a woody stem with compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia commutata is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall and is adapted to various soil types. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing nectar for native pollinators.
